textBeforeTable: RSS Quote Reply } } proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade; proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade'; proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade; proxy_http_version 1.1; proxy_pass http://localhost:3000; location / { server_name your-domain.com; listen 80; server { /etc/nginx/conf.d/domainame.com.conf I have a node application that uses websockets. I'm using a custom config file like this. However, when I post to the application, the post isn't appearing in the client side of the application. Since it's using websockets to communicate between client and server, i'm wondering if I have a problem with the port numbers. You can see in my config that the server is listening on 80, but the proxy_pass is set to localhost:3000. Should these numbers be the same? if so can I set Nginx to listen on 3000?
